vulnerabilities.title: JWT Algorithm Confusion Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.description: Server accepts JWT tokens with 'none' algorithm, allowing signature bypass.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Strictly validate JWT algorithm. Reject 'none' algorithm tokens.

vulnerabilities.title: Authentication Bypass via SQL Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Login form at /admin/login vulnerable to SQL injection authentication bypass.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Use parameterized queries. Implement proper input validation. Use prepared statements.

evidence.response_preview:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Admin Login - FileShr</title>
    <script src="https://cdn.tailwindcss.com"></script>
    <link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com">
    <link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com" crossorigin>
    <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Inter:wght@300;400;500;600;700&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">

vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: Login form at https://fileshr.ddns.net/admin/login is vulnerable to SQL injection authentication bypass. Attacker can gain unauthorized access without valid credentials.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Use parameterized queries/prepared statements. Never concatenate user input into SQL queries. Implement proper input validation and use ORM frameworks.

vulnerabilities.title: Predictable Session Tokens
vulnerabilities.description: Session tokens follow a predictable sequential or incremental pattern. Attacker can predict valid session IDs and hijack user sessions.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Use cryptographically secure random number generator (CSPRNG) for session token generation. Ensure minimum 128 bits of entropy.

vulnerabilities.title: Default/Weak Credentials
vulnerabilities.description: Application accepts default credentials: admin/admin. Attacker can gain unauthorized access.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Force password change on first login. Implement strong password policy. Disable default accounts.

vulnerabilities.title: NoSQL Injection Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: Login endpoint is vulnerable to NoSQL injection, allowing authentication bypass without valid credentials.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Sanitize and validate all inputs. Use parameterized queries. Implement input type checking. Use ORM/ODM libraries.

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: LDAP-based authentication is vulnerable to injection, allowing bypass without valid credentials.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Escape LDAP special characters. Use parameterized LDAP queries. Validate inputs against whitelist.

vulnerabilities.title: XML/XPath Injection Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: XML-based authentication is vulnerable to injection attacks.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Use parameterized XPath queries. Validate and sanitize XML inputs. Use XML schema validation.

vulnerabilities.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.description: Application reflects user input without proper encoding. Vulnerable contexts: Potential XSS. Example payload: <script>alert(1)</script>
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement context-aware output encoding. Use Content Security Policy (CSP). Sanitize user input. Use frameworks with auto-escaping.

vulnerabilities.description: Application returns database error messages when special characters are used.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Use parameterized queries/prepared statements. Never concatenate user input into SQL queries.

vulnerabilities.title: 2FA Brute Force - No Rate Limiting
vulnerabilities.description: 2FA verification endpoint lacks rate limiting, allowing attackers to brute force 6-digit codes (1 million possibilities).
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement strict rate limiting (3-5 attempts). Add account lockout. Implement CAPTCHA after failed attempts. Use longer codes or time-based expiry.

vulnerabilities.title: 2FA Brute Force - No Rate Limiting
vulnerabilities.description: 2FA verification endpoint lacks rate limiting, allowing attackers to brute force 6-digit codes (1 million possibilities).
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement strict rate limiting (3-5 attempts). Add account lockout. Implement CAPTCHA after failed attempts. Use longer codes or time-based expiry.

vulnerabilities.title: 2FA Brute Force - No Rate Limiting
vulnerabilities.description: 2FA verification endpoint lacks rate limiting, allowing attackers to brute force 6-digit codes (1 million possibilities).
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement strict rate limiting (3-5 attempts). Add account lockout. Implement CAPTCHA after failed attempts. Use longer codes or time-based expiry.

vulnerabilities.title: 2FA Brute Force - No Rate Limiting
vulnerabilities.description: 2FA verification endpoint lacks rate limiting, allowing attackers to brute force 6-digit codes (1 million possibilities).
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement strict rate limiting (3-5 attempts). Add account lockout. Implement CAPTCHA after failed attempts. Use longer codes or time-based expiry.

vulnerabilities.title: 2FA Brute Force - No Rate Limiting
vulnerabilities.description: 2FA verification endpoint lacks rate limiting, allowing attackers to brute force 6-digit codes (1 million possibilities).
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement strict rate limiting (3-5 attempts). Add account lockout. Implement CAPTCHA after failed attempts. Use longer codes or time-based expiry.

vulnerabilities.title: Rate Limit Bypass via Header Manipulation
vulnerabilities.description: Rate limiting can be bypassed by manipulating X-Forwarded-For header, allowing unlimited authentication attempts.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement rate limiting at application level, not just by IP. Use session-based or account-based rate limiting. Validate and sanitize proxy headers.

evidence.vulnerability: Rate limiting bypassed via header manipulation

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Authentication on Protected Resource
vulnerabilities.description: Protected resource /dashboard is accessible without authentication.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement proper authentication checks on all protected resources. Use middleware/decorators for consistent auth enforcement.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing X-Frame-Options Header
vulnerabilities.description: The X-Frame-Options header is not set, making the site vulnerable to clickjacking attacks.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add "X-Frame-Options: DENY" or "X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN" header to all responses.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Content-Security-Policy Header
vulnerabilities.description: No Content Security Policy detected. CSP helps prevent XSS and data injection attacks.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement a Content-Security-Policy header with appropriate directives for your application.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Strict-Transport-Security Header
vulnerabilities.description: HSTS header not found. Site may be vulnerable to protocol downgrade attacks.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add "Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains" header.

vulnerabilities.title: Cookie Missing Secure Flag
vulnerabilities.description: Cookies are set without the Secure flag, allowing transmission over unencrypted connections.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add "Secure" flag to all cookies: Set-Cookie: name=value; Secure

vulnerabilities.title: Cookie Missing SameSite Attribute
vulnerabilities.description: Cookies lack SameSite attribute, vulnerable to CSRF attacks.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add "SameSite=Strict" or "SameSite=Lax" to cookies.

vulnerabilities.title: Input Reflection Detected - SQL Injection Pattern
vulnerabilities.description: User input "'" is reflected in the response without proper encoding.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement proper input validation and output encoding. Use context-aware escaping.

vulnerabilities.title: Sensitive Endpoints Discovered
vulnerabilities.description: Found accessible sensitive paths: /admin/login (200), /dashboard (200)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Restrict access to administrative interfaces. Remove development/debug files. Use .htaccess or firewall rules.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing X-Content-Type-Options Header
vulnerabilities.description: Missing header allows MIME-sniffing which could lead to security vulnerabilities.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add "X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff" header to all responses.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Referrer-Policy Header
vulnerabilities.description: No Referrer-Policy set. Sensitive information in URLs may leak to third parties.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add "Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin" or stricter policy.

vulnerabilities.title: Server Version Disclosure
vulnerabilities.description: Server header reveals version information: nginx/1.26.3
vulnerabilities.remediation: Configure server to hide version information in Server header.

vulnerabilities.title: 2FA Code Reuse Risk Assessment
vulnerabilities.description: 2FA implementation should be manually verified to ensure codes are single-use and expire within 30-60 seconds.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement single-use TOTP codes. Add 30-second expiration. Invalidate code after successful use.

evidence.recommendation: Verify that 2FA codes are single-use and expire quickly

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Permissions-Policy Header
vulnerabilities.description: No Permissions-Policy header found. Browser features not explicitly controlled.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add Permissions-Policy header to control browser features like geolocation, camera, etc.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing X-XSS-Protection Header
vulnerabilities.description: Legacy XSS protection header not set (still used by older browsers).
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add "X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block" header.

vulnerabilities.title: Certificate Expiration Check
vulnerabilities.description: Certificate expires on: Mar  4 14:16:54 2026 GMT
vulnerabilities.remediation: Monitor certificate expiration and renew before expiry.
